result.execSummary:
The defendant William Buss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must install IID on all vehicles titled in his name and upon issuance of valid drivers license.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3). 

Can be transferred to any other County in the State of WI with approval from Sheriff(s).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Buss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for half price IID - denied by court - copy to defendant

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant William Buss in court.   Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:05 AM. Buss had met with the DA and has signed paperwork in regards to that, has already gone thru waiver of right to attorney and plead NG but DA has been sick and have not gotten the offer yet due to that. Discussion on what has been done with State and issues with offer from State and the fact that the DA has been sick and haven't been able to finalize things. Court responds. Reces to fill out plea questionnare. Recalled at 9:35 AM with same appearances. Buss pleads G to only count, acknowledges three prior convictions. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation of: 365 days in FC jail - stayed - place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 60 days conditional jail - asks for two weeks to report and that he be allowed to report in any other county in the State of WI, 26 month DL revocation, IID for 26 months on DL and any vehicle titled in his name, fine of $2009.00, restitution of $35.00 for blood draw. Buss agrees with the recommendations as offered by State, makes statement, remorseful. Court reads letter that the defendant provided last time in court that was sealed. State - other conditions of probation would include: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor stores, 100 hours of community service. Buss agrees. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 365 days in FC jail - stayed - place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 60 days conditional jail - can be transferred to any other County in the State of WI with approval from Sheriff(s) - begin sentence on or before 8:30 AM on 2/26/16 - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), 26 month DL revocation, IID for 26 months on DL and any vehicle titled in his name, fine of $2009.00 - take bond posted - remainder due today, restitution of $35.00 for blood draw - pay today, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service - to be completed within first 6 months of probation, submit DNA sample - paid today, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant William Buss in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:03 AM. State advises the court that they have talked to resolve the case, no blood results yet, and defendant would still prefer to work with State to get matter resolved. State asks for an adjournment to get blood results back and to come to an agreement to resolve the matter. Court continues bond, sets for another AIA, court makes sure that the defendant understands the penalties. Recess to fill out waiver of right to attorney (10:07 AM).  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:15 am. Recalled at 10:18 AM with same appearances. Buss has filled out Waiver of Right to Attorney. Court goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to counsel, finds he is competent to represent himself and will allow him to do so. Buss pleads NG at this point. Court accepts plea. Buss has handed the Court some correpondence, State is aware of it, Court seals at this point and will read at time of sentencing. Buss understands. Adjourned at 10:26 AM.
No consumption of alcohol and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Defendant William Buss in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:03 AM. State has spoken to the defendant prior to Court and instructed him to make an appointment with him after Court. Buss has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Buss understands charges and penalties, would like to address bond, does not want an attorney for today, needs more time to hire/speak with counsel. State - bond - no objections to a reduction in bond to $2000.00 cash for stated reasons. Court reduces bond to $2,000.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL. Court sets for AIA. Court gives ramifications of returning without an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:45 am.
in Support of Search Warrant - Forced Blood Draw
No consumption of alcohol. No operation of a motor vehicle.
